meanings.definition: A tall vertical structure used to support overhead power lines.
meanings.sent1: The pylon stood tall against the sky, holding up the power lines.
meanings.sent2: Drivers passed by the pylon as they traveled along the highway.
meanings.sent3: The birds perched on the pylon, pretending to be kings of the world.
meanings.sent4: The pylon loomed like a giant guardian over the city, protecting it with its strength.
meanings.sent5: In the storm, the lightning struck the pylon, lighting up the night with a fierce glow.

meanings.definition: A marking post or tower at the side of a road or alongside a body of water.
meanings.sent1: The pylon by the river guided the boats safely along the water.
meanings.sent2: The road workers painted the pylon with bright colors for visibility.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous kids played hide-and-seek around the pylon, giggling with joy.
meanings.sent4: The pylon at the edge of the road stood like a silent sentinel, watching over the passing cars.
meanings.sent5: The sunset painted the pylon in hues of orange and pink, creating a beautiful scene by the lake.

meanings.definition: A structure used to mark the turning point in a race.
meanings.sent1: The athletes sprinted towards the pylon, eager to reach the finish line.
meanings.sent2: Spectators cheered as the runners circled the pylon in the final lap.
meanings.sent3: The playful dog ran circles around the pylon, thinking it was a new friend.
meanings.sent4: The pylon at the race track symbolized the moment of victory, inspiring the competitors.
meanings.sent5: As the runners approached the pylon, the crowd erupted in excitement, urging them on to the end.
